title: Quickly change size of Thunderbird message subjects

creator: soundhill1

title: .txt file arrives inline and corrupt - Thunderbird 115
content:
I have attachments set to be downloadable. I regularly receive a .txt file which I need to import into an analysis programme, but it always shows inline. I've checked all the settings and inline is definitely not selected. The content it shows is incomplete and corrupt so even if I copy it and paste it into another file it is not useable.

Windows Mail and another email client both show it as a downloadable attachment so there is nothing wrong with the file or how it is sent. When it is downloaded from these programs it opens as a regular txt document in notepad.

I have noticed that the .txt file has unix(LF) rather than the usual Windows (CRLF) in the footer. Could that 

have something to do with it?

I hate having to run Windows mail in tandem just to receive these files. Any suggestions please?
creator: mcwoozle

title: I can no longer send email from my thunderbird app with xfinity email accounts
content: I can no longer send email from my Thunderbird app with xfinity email accounts. I have spent many hours yesterday and today with xfinity security techs, but they have not fixed anything and have no idea what is causing this. Before last night at 9pm it has been working fine for years and years. I can receive email for these accounts in thunderbird, but can only send email from my primary xfinity account. Please help?

title: seeking howto configure to use "template" email for routine messages
content:
How do I create template email messages then use them for routine correspondence?

Might I use LibreOffice or similar for messages without the need to attach a content file?

I would really like to select one of my templates and then have a script run to prompt me for the variable content. (NOTE -- I used to do this sort of thing with Basic and Microsoft® Office™ in the distant past... open a template, get a dialog box that asked for variable details, fill the fields, submit, see a document with the desired content.)

I routinely send the same message content again and again. I must alter minor details in that content but the bulk of the message remains the same. For example, consider a message that announces a monthly meeting of a small social group.

Thank you in advance, ~~~ 0;-Dan
creator: dan276

title: flood of calendar "changed on server" pop-up notices
content:
How do I configure such that I don't require some sort of acknowledgement of IMAP and CALENDAR changes at a shared server? Is this a Thunderbird & Linux configuration effort? Might I require configuration at the IMAP server or at the GMAIL server?

I get a flood of pop-up notices in Thunderbird saying "changed on server" What makes this a serious situation is that I must end my session in Thunderbird to stop the flood. At that point I can select the button that will dismiss things.

My Configuration for email 1. I have an IMAP server under my own domain. 2. I use two different email accounts on that server. 3. I have GMAIL account access configured 4. I have deployed items 1-3 on two different laptops 5. I have deployed items 1-3 with K9 email on my Galaxy phone 6. I have deployed items 1-3 with K9 email on my Galaxy tablet

My Configuration for calendar 1. I rely on Google Calendar as a server 2. I have deployed access through Thunderbird on two differnt laptops 3. I have deploy access through "Business Calendar 2" on my Galaxy phone 4. I have deploy access through "Business Calendar 2" on my Galaxy tablet 5.. I share calendar details through Google Calendar with family and colleagues

My Facilities 1. Thinkpad X220t running Linux Mint 21.2 with Cinnamon Desktop 2. System76 Adder-WS running Linux Mint 21.2 with Cinnamon Desktop 3. Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra phone running Android v13 with UI 5.1 4.Samsung Galaxy Tab-S6 tablet running Android v12 with UI 4.1.1
creator: dan276

title: Cannot export one of my calendars
content: I have three calendars that I use on one of Tbirds installed on one of my PCs. I can export two of them but not the third one. If I click on the third calendar in the left column then select export, nothing happens. When I do the same with the other two, a dialog box opens where I can change or add the ICS file and its destination folder. If I try using Events and Tasks to export, the same thing happens. It is a mystery to me. Does anyone know of a fix for this? I am using Tbird 102.11.0 (64-bit) release.

title: Thunderbird Question

creator: lashment

title: Increasing height of lines in message list
content:
I've searched the knowledge base already, and can't quite find the answer to my question.

I use Thunderbird 115.1.0 on Windows. My eyesight isn't the best, so I've had to set the font larger. But I can't find any way to increase the height of the rows; that is, the space between messages on the list. There used to be a "row height" among the config options; I can't find that now -- or perhaps it is called something else.

I support Thunderbird and have used it for years -- but I'm older now, and can't see as well. I can't continue to use Thunderbird if there's no way to adjust the height of the rows.

I'm familiar enough with CSS to create a userChrome.css file; I just need to know the exact code to include.

Thank you.
creator: bix

title: "Get messages" for individual accounts (V 115.1.0)
content:
I just updated Version 102.14.0.0 to Version 115.1.0. Previously I was able to click on "Get Messages" and select which account I wanted to get new messages from. With Version 115, "Get Messages" gets new messages for all my accounts... all 12 of my accounts!

How/where can I change "Get Messages" so it retrieves new messages only for the account I want to get new messages from?
creator: David12846

title: Can I create a list of "correspondent" mail IDs from a specific folder of emails?
content:
My email ID is with my ISP (Internet Service Provider). This email ID was created 20 years or so ago, when I didn't know better re having my email ID tied to an ISP. They have decided to be exceedingly unreasonable in rates and I have switched ISPs. But now I need to set up a new e-mail ID; one not associated with an ISP.

I did a search of my Thunderbird email to find all email from the last 25 months (past 2 years plus a one month buffer) and created a Thunderbird folder from that search. I want to extract the email IDs for all "correspondents" from this folder, put it into Excel and filter to remove duplicate correspondents. Then I will cleanse the list of all "correspondents" I do not wish to share my new email ID with and send e-mails to the rest advising those recipients to start using my new email ID.

I have been unsuccessful in several attempts to extract a list. I have the Thunderbird folder created from the search. I can "Select All", but this gets me the contents of all emails rather than the displayed metadata (subject, correspondents, date, location). Note that this folder contains over 5600 entries so I wish to avoid a manual process if at all possible.

Is there a way I can accomplish want I want? Any technique can, but doesn't have to, use the folder of emails created from the search.

Thanks
creator: dgillesp
